data.title: Slipknot Announce Vinyl Release Of Live Album 'Live At MSG'
data.meta_description: Slipknot will release Live At MSG for the first time on double vinyl on August 18th to commemorate the 15th
data.text:
Slipknot will release Live At MSG for the first time on double vinyl on August 18th to commemorate the 15th anniversary of their fourth album All Hope Is Gone.

Recorded during their performance at New Yorkâ€™s historic Madison Square Garden during the All Hope Is Gone tour, the live show was originally included as a bonus disc for the 10th anniversary edition of All Hope is Gone.

The upcoming release features new artwork by Clown and will be available on various special edition colored vinyl including coke bottle clear with silver splatter, light blue with silver splatter, clear with silver splatter, lemonade with silver splatter, black ice with silver splatter, and standard black.

Pre-orders can be found here.

Slipknot are currently on their European tour. Check out all their dates here. This marks their first outing since the departure of Craig Jones. Jones has been replaced by a mysterious new keyboardist whose identity has yet to be revealed.
